Chicago.name: The Magic Parlour
Chicago.description: A hidden gem in Chicago's theater scene, The Magic Parlour is an intimate magic show hosted by Dennis Watkins. It's a one-of-a-kind experience, offering mind-blowing illusions in a cozy, vintage-style parlor.

Chicago.name: The International Museum of Surgical Science
Chicago.description: This unique museum is housed in a historic mansion and offers an eye-opening look at the history of surgery, medical instruments, and more. It’s an unexpected space for anyone fascinated by the history of medicine.
Chicago.address: 1524 N Lake Shore Dr, Chicago, IL 60610

Chicago.name: The Charnel House
Chicago.description: Located in a former funeral home, The Charnel House is a performing arts venue offering a range of performances, from theater to art installations, all in an eerie, offbeat environment.

New York.name: The City Reliquary
New York.description: A quirky museum in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, The City Reliquary is a hidden gem showcasing New York City artifacts, from subway tokens to vintage Brooklyn memorabilia, all displayed in a charming, eclectic space.

New York.name: The Elevated Acre
New York.description: A hidden urban oasis tucked above the bustling streets of Lower Manhattan, The Elevated Acre is a peaceful park with incredible views, perfect for a quiet lunch or a short escape from the city’s noise.

New York.name: Museum
New York.description: This tiny museum, located in a former elevator shaft in Tribeca, showcases strange and curious artifacts, from ancient medical instruments to oddities of modern life. It’s a fascinating, offbeat destination for those in search of something unusual.

New York.name: The Ghostbusters Firehouse
New York.description: Fans of the 1980s classic film will appreciate the Firehouse in Tribeca, which served as the headquarters for the Ghostbusters. While it's an active firehouse, fans can appreciate the outside and its iconic role in the movie.
New York.address: 14 N Moore St, New York, NY 10013
